title: Lost all my bookmarks, logins, cookies etc after resetting my Windows.
content:
1) Cannot restore them even after logging into account with same email address. 2) Windows.old does not exist. 3) Tried %APPDATA% method to use "Gibberish".default folder for profile recovery. (Might need some guidance here but overall it did not work too.

Firefox was always logged in with same email account and it should've synced all the data.
creator: rpandey

title: Message via bitdefender
content:
I work with a laptop @home and have installed Bitdefender for security reasons. Today I had a warning (it's in Dutch, I do not know if that is a problem). Functie: Preventie van online dreigingen

firefox.exe heeft geprobeerd om op basis van een niet-overeenstemmend certificaat een verbinding te maken met browser.pipe.aria.microsoft.com. We hebben de verbinding geblokkeerd om uw gegevens veilig te houden, vermits het gebruikte certificaat voor een ander webadres werd uitgegeven. Toevoegen aan uitsluitingen

""It says something like firefox.exe has tried to make a connection based on a not approved certificate with browser.pipe.aria.microsoft.com. We have blocked the connection to keep your data safe. I can add this to exclusions"" or something like that.

I have never seen something like this before and I would like to know what it means and if I should exclude this, etc. So that's why I send you a mail to check it. Like to hear from you and many thanks in advance. Greetz Karin
creator: karinpankras

title: Flickering cursor on 102.0.1
content: So far I have tried everything possible, clean reinstall, reboot machine, safe mode, turning off hardware acceleration; issue stands that cursor is in consistent flickering mode and completely vanishes when stopping moving cursor, as if its default state while firefox window is active is to be "visibility:hidden" and tries enfocre it as much as possible when moving; system: windows 10 issue started very recently,. when firefox crashed and crash reporter rebooted browser, as if something went completely broken for specifically firefox deep inside system (yes I also purged all mozilla related stuff from registry when clean reinstalled)

title: My preferences won't save
content:
Hi, I'm back to an older computer where I already had Firefox installed. I have it installed and synchronized on 3 other computers and it works perfectly there. My main issue is that in the settings, Firefox is supposed to open with all the tabs I had opened when I closed it. It doesn't... It sends me to the home page. Second issue, also unique: I'm using Duck and go as search engine, and I have the same issue: it doesn's save my preferences (when it does on the same computer with Brave browser) Should I uninstall it all and try again? I already applied all the solutions suggested in th online help pages...

Thanks! Best,

title: Firefox doesn't display the font Helvetica correctly
content:
• The attached image shows Firefox (on the right) not displaying Helvetica correctly. It appears jagged and not pleasant to look at. The browser on the left is Edge and all Chromium based web browsers seem to render it as it should.
  • I've tried to look into (about:preferences#general) and the option that says (Allow pages to choose their own fonts, instead of your selections above) is ticked.
  • I've also tried reinstalling the browser, clearing the website cache and also, removing my profile from it. None of these seemed to fix the issue.
  • It's been persistent for quite some time now, however I didn't really find any articles regarding this issue. 
  Any help would be greatly appreciated!
creator: CircuitMoon

title: problema riproduzione audio
content: ho questo problema: ho win 7 con due utenti A e B per accesso al sistema operativo. se uso firefox come utente "A" non mi riproduce l'audio di alcuni siti tipo questo www.radiololgiata.net, mentre se uso firefox come utente "B" sempre dallo stesso PC mi funziona tutto . come posso risolvere il problema per la riproduzione audio. Ho la necessità di usare anche l'utente "A" poichè ho salvato PSW e segnalibri e non voglio perderli. ho disistallato firefox e reistallato, ma quando fa il ripristino della vecchia versione non funziona l'audio, ho paura di cancellare tutto firefox se no perdo segnalibri ecc. mi dite come risolvere il problema audio? PS credo che si sia o fatto qualche aggiornamento o ci sta spuntato qualcosa che io non trovo. Grazie

title: Enable touch scrolling / gestures in Firefox browser on Fedora 36 / KDE X11
content:
I have read through other bug reports about this issue that has seemed to happen multiple times over the past 5+ years...

I am unable to use my laptop touchscreen in Firefox browser for scrolling or long-hold to right click. Attempted scrolling or pinch-zoom just highlights text.

System info Fedora 36 Plasma (X11)

Application Basics Firefox 102.0 Mozilla Firefox for Fedora fedora - 1.0 Build ID 20220629075744 User Agent Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:102.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/102.0 OS Linux 5.18.11-200.fc36.x86_64 #1 SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Tue Jul 12 22:52:35 UTC 2022 Multiprocess Windows 2/2 Safe Mode false Asynchronous Pan/Zoom wheel input enabled; touch input enabled; scrollbar drag enabled; keyboard enabled; autoscroll enabled; smooth pinch-zoom enabled

Configure options --enable-application=browser MOZILLA_OFFICIAL=1 --update-channel=release CC=gcc CXX=g++ AR=gcc-ar NM=gcc-nm MOZ_PROFILE_USE=1 --enable-js-shell --enable-system-ffi NODEJS=/builddir/build/BUILDROOT/bin/node-stdout-nonblocking-wrapper --enable-default-toolkit=cairo-gtk3-wayland --with-mozilla-api-keyfile=/builddir/build/BUILD/firefox-102.0/mozilla-api-key --with-google-location-service-api-keyfile=/builddir/build/BUILD/firefox-102.0/google-loc-api-key --with-google-safebrowsing-api-keyfile=/builddir/build/BUILD/firefox-102.0/google-api-key --with-unsigned-addon-scopes=app,system --allow-addon-sideload --with-system-jpeg --with-system-fdk-aac --without-wasm-sandboxed-libraries --with-system-nss --disable-updater STRIP=/bin/true --with-system-zlib --enable-official-branding --libdir=/usr/lib64 --prefix=/usr

added to /.bashrc "export MOZ_USE_XINPUT2=1"

I see in the config options that the GTK build specifies Wayland. I am very new to all of this so I am not totally sure what that means or if it makes a big difference..? I'm running X11, not Wayland.

Any help is very much appreciated!
creator: rosz.ren

title: First tab suddenly closed
content:
Since I updated to Firefox 102.0.1 (64 bit) I have a problem. Firefox automatically close the first tab. This happens in two different situations:

1) I close Firefox. When I re-open it, the first tab is missing. It doesn't happen all the times. But at least 60%. (My Firefox is set to show the tabs of the last time when I open it).

2) I'm downloading some file from my email or other place. Sometimes it goes fine. Other times the tab I'm using suddenly closes.

This problem has never happened with any other Firefox version.

title: Firefox Browser Can't Open Without My Permission
content:
Firefox has been updated on my PC at least 100 times. It ALWAYS brings up the screen asking me to verify if thiis program can make changes to my computer, Why? Is v 102.1 the latest? I don't know I see other comments about other versions.

And so many more issues I am about to pull every last hair out of my head. I don't even know how your Bookmarks work, nothing like I've ever seen. And, why does Firefox Browser open in different pages, sometimes. I'll have 2 rows or 3 rows of add-ons. Sometimes the font is so tiny I cannot read it, other times it's just fine.

I know what you are going to do. You'll give me some instructions with words that mean nothing to me. Then you'll provide articles I can read, and they mean nothing to me either. I AM NOT an IT person. I just want to turn on my computer and have it work properly JUST ONCE! Wouldn't that be great, then maybe twice in a row!

I thoiught i would be happy with Firefox, but I'm not. Just like I'm not happy with Windows platforms from 7 onward. Instead of making things easier for the everyday user all you do is make things more confusing and complex. I read some of the questions on this website and I don't even know what they're talking about.

I just want Firefox to WORK
creator: Rhonda_89
